alert.note: Alert for Major; Woods; Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 8:13AM CDT until May 25 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Waynoka affecting Woodward, Major and Woods Counties.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC093-151-153-250115- /O.CON.KOUN.FL.Y.0010.000000T0000Z-220525T1800Z/ /WANO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 813 AM CDT Tue May 24 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Waynoka. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull conditions exist along the river... and some overflows may occur over some low-lying areas near the river. The river reach affected extends from near Freedom upstream... to the U.S. Highway 281 crossing south of Little Sahara State Park near Waynoka... to near Orienta in Major County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 7.7 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 7.5 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
